name: Roy Moore
description: Former Alabama Chief Justice Roy Moore faced multiple allegations of sexual misconduct in 2017. Multiple women accused Moore of sexual assault when they were teenagers and he was in his 30s. The allegations first surfaced in November 2017 during his U.S. Senate campaign. Moore lost the special election to Democrat Doug Jones.

name: Dennis Hastert
description: Former Speaker of the House Dennis Hastert sexually abused high school students while working as a wrestling coach. He was convicted in 2016 of structuring bank withdrawals to evade currency reporting requirements, related to paying hush money to victims of his abuse. He received a 15-month prison sentence.

name: Joseph Russell Dendy
description: Cobb County GOP Chairman Joseph Russell Dendy pleaded guilty in 2017 to 13 charges including child molestation, enticing a child for indecent purposes, and aggravated sexual battery. He received a life sentence with 30 years to serve. The crimes occurred from 2004 to 2011. He was arrested in May 2016.

name: Ralph Shortey
description: Oklahoma state senator and Donald Trump's 2016 Oklahoma campaign chair Ralph Shortey was arrested in March 2017 after being found in a motel room with a 17-year-old boy. He pleaded guilty in 2017 to child sex trafficking and was sentenced to 15 years in federal prison in 2018.

name: Mark Foley
description: U.S. Representative Mark Foley (R-FL) resigned from Congress on September 29, 2006, after it was revealed he had sent sexually explicit instant messages and emails to teenage boys who had served as congressional pages. The scandal broke less than six weeks before the 2006 midterm elections.

name: Tim Nolan
description: Former Kentucky judge and Trump Campbell County campaign chair Tim Nolan pleaded guilty in 2018 to 21 counts including human trafficking and child sex trafficking involving 19 victims (7 minors). He was sentenced to 20 years in federal prison. He used his position and threatened victims with arrest unless they performed sex acts.

name: Blake Farenthold
description: U.S. Representative Blake Farenthold (R-TX) resigned from Congress in April 2018 after it was revealed he used $84,000 in taxpayer money to settle a sexual harassment lawsuit filed by his former communications director. The lawsuit alleged gender discrimination, sexual harassment, and creating a hostile work environment.

name: Donald Lukens
description: U.S. Representative Donald 'Buz' Lukens (R-OH) was convicted in 1989 of contributing to the delinquency of a minor after paying a 16-year-old girl $40 for sex. He was convicted again in 1996 on bribery and conspiracy charges related to his time in Congress and sentenced to 30 months in prison.

name: Dan Crane
description: U.S. Representative Dan Crane (R-IL) was censured by the House of Representatives on July 20, 1983, by a vote of 421-3 for having sex with a 17-year-old congressional page. He lost his re-election bid in 1984.

name: Edison Misla Aldarondo
description: Puerto Rico House Speaker Edison Misla Aldarondo was charged in 2002 with rape of a 17-year-old friend of his stepdaughter. He was convicted of attempted rape, sexual abuse of a minor, and four counts of lewd conduct for molesting his stepdaughter beginning when she was 9 years old. He was sentenced to 13 years in prison in 2004.

name: Mark A. Grethen
description: Republican businessman and activist Mark A. Grethen was convicted in 2001 of six counts of sex crimes involving children (two counts each of forcible sodomy, aggravated sexual battery, and indecent liberties with a child). He was sentenced to 26 years in prison. Shortly after conviction, he was briefly named 'Republican of the Year' in 2002 by the National Republican Congressional Committee. He was killed in prison in 2021.

name: Beverly Russell
description: Christian Coalition leader and South Carolina Republican Party official Beverly Russell admitted in 1988 to sexually molesting his stepdaughter Susan Smith beginning when she was 15 years old. The abuse continued for years. During Smith's 1995 murder trial, Russell testified about the abuse and urged the jury to spare her life, saying he bore responsibility for her actions.

name: Robert Bauman
description: U.S. Representative Robert Bauman (R-MD) was charged on October 3, 1980, with soliciting sex from a 16-year-old male prostitute. Despite being a staunch conservative who often criticized American morality, charges were dropped after he completed court-supervised rehabilitation. He lost his re-election bid in November 1980.

name: Stephen White
description: Reverend Stephen White, who preached against homosexuality and sexual promiscuity at Yale and other campuses, was convicted in 2003 of criminal solicitation to commit involuntary deviate sexual intercourse. He was arrested in June 2003 after offering $20 to a 14-year-old boy in West Chester, Pennsylvania, for permission to perform oral sex. He faced a minimum 3-year prison term.

name: Jon Matthews
description: Conservative talk show host Jon Matthews pleaded guilty in June 2004 to indecency with a child for exposing his genitals to an 11-year-old girl at his Sugar Land, Texas, home in October 2003. He initially received deferred adjudication but his probation was revoked in 2007 after violations, and he was sentenced to 3 years in prison.

name: Howard Scott Heldreth
description: Anti-abortion and anti-gay activist Howard Scott Heldreth was charged in 1992 with rape and kidnapping of a 16-year-old girl. He pleaded guilty to sexual battery and was sentenced to probation and required to register as a sex offender in Florida.

name: Strom Thurmond
description: U.S. Senator Strom Thurmond had sex with Carrie Butler, a 15-year-old Black housemaid working for his family, when he was 22 years old in 1925. Their daughter, Essie Mae Washington-Williams, was born in October 1925. Thurmond, who became known for pro-segregation politics, kept his daughter's existence secret until after his death in 2003.

name: Peter Dibble
description: Connecticut legislator and Stonington first selectman Peter Dibble pleaded no contest in 2004 to having an inappropriate relationship with a 13-year-old girl. He was charged with repeated acts of sexual misconduct with the girl starting when she was 10 years old, including French-kissing her on at least 40 occasions.

name: Andrew Buhr
description: Republican politician and Missouri House candidate Andrew Buhr was charged in 2002 with two counts of first-degree sodomy with a 13-year-old boy. He was appointed by President Bush to the Commission on Presidential Scholars in November 2002 but lost the position within a month when the charges were filed. A mistrial was declared in January 2004 after he claimed he thought the boy was older.

name: Keith Westmoreland
description: Tennessee state representative and former Sullivan County executive Keith Westmoreland was arrested in 2002 on seven felony counts of lewd and lascivious exhibition to girls under age 16. He exposed his genitals to children at a hotel pool in Sandestin, Florida. He later committed suicide.

name: John Allen Burt
description: Anti-abortion activist and Christian fundamentalist John Allen Burt was arrested in 2003 for molesting a 15-year-old girl living at his shelter 'Our Father's House.' He was convicted on April 1, 2004, of five counts of lewd and lascivious molestation and conduct. He was sentenced to 18 years in prison and died while serving his sentence in 2013.

name: Keola Childs
description: Hawaii County Councilman Keola Childs pleaded guilty in 2000 to first-degree sexual assault for molesting a male child. The charge carried a possible sentence of 20 years in prison.

name: Parker J. Bena
description: Republican activist Parker J. Bena was a presidential elector for George W. Bush in 2000. In 2001, he pleaded guilty to possession of child pornography, including images of children as young as 3 years old, on his home computer. He was sentenced to 30 months in federal prison and fined $18,000.

name: Richard A. Dasen Sr.
description: Montana businessman and Republican benefactor Richard A. Dasen Sr. was convicted in May 2005 of promotion of prostitution, sexual abuse of children, and multiple felony prostitution counts. He paid women and girls for sex, took sexual photographs of girls under 18, and had sex with a 15-year-old girl. He was sentenced to 20 years with 18 suspended in September 2005.

name: Larry Corrigan
description: GOP activist and director of financial operations at the King County Prosecutor's office for over 25 years, Larry Corrigan was arrested in 2006 in an Internet sting for attempting to arrange sex with a 13-year-old girl. He pleaded guilty in 2007 to one count of second-degree attempted child molestation and one count of communicating with a minor for immoral purposes. He was sentenced to 23 months in prison, received three to four years of probation, must register as a sex offender, and must complete sexual deviancy evaluation and treatment. Corrigan also was accused of embezzling over $70,000 from campaign funds between May 2004 and early 2005.

name: Scott Eller Cortelyou
description: Republican radio host Scott Eller Cortelyou was the host of 'Business for Breakfast' on KRCN 1060-AM in Colorado. He was arrested for having sexually graphic online conversations with someone he thought was a 12-year-old girl in August 2006. Cortelyou pleaded guilty in 2007 to Internet luring and attempted Internet sexual exploitation of a child (both class 5 felonies). He was sentenced to 18 months of intensive supervised probation and must register as a sex offender.

name: Brian J. Doyle
description: Brian J. Doyle, 55, was the deputy press secretary for the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. He was arrested on April 4, 2006, at his home in Silver Spring, Maryland, after being caught in an undercover sting attempting to initiate sexually explicit conversation with a 14-year-old girl (actually a sheriff's deputy working undercover). He was indicted on 23 felony counts including seven counts of using a computer to seduce a child and sixteen counts of transmitting harmful materials to a child. He pleaded no contest to the charges.

name: Matthew Joseph Elliott
description: Matthew Joseph Elliott was a consultant for Mitt Romney's Commonwealth political action committee in early 2006, joining the PAC in early 2006 but leaving after only a few weeks. Elliott is a registered sex offender who was convicted in Iowa in October 2006 of exploiting a minor. He was also arrested in connection with the death of a 7-month-old baby girl in Iowa, with autopsy ruling the death a homicide. Elliott was questioned in the baby's death but was not charged at the time of reporting.

name: Donald Fleischman
description: Donald Fleischman was chairman and treasurer of the Brown County (Wisconsin) Republican Party. He was charged in 2007-2008 with child enticement, contributing to the delinquency of a child, and exposing his genitals. The charges related to an incident with a 16-year-old boy from a juvenile facility. Police found the boy hiding in Fleischman's closet in underwear and a T-shirt, and the boy claimed Fleischman gave him beer and marijuana. Fleischman resigned from his post as county GOP chair. State Republicans subsequently disbanded the Green Bay area's Republican Party, citing inability to muster enough officers to pick a new leader.

name: George Roche III
description: George Roche III was president of conservative Hillsdale College in Michigan from 1971 to 1999. In October 1999, Roche resigned after allegations surfaced of a 19-year sexual affair with his daughter-in-law, Lissa Jackson Roche. The scandal erupted when Lissa publicly disclosed the alleged affair. Hours after making the disclosure, Lissa was found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the college arboretum. Her death was ruled a suicide, though no suicide note was found. Roche's version claims he never confirmed the affair occurred.

name: Bishop Daniel Paprocki
description: Bishop Daniel Paprocki of the Diocese of Springfield, Illinois has been accused of protecting pedophile priests and enabling abuse within the Catholic Church. Under Paprocki's leadership, the Springfield Diocese was the last in Illinois to disclose a list of clergy with substantiated child sexual abuse allegations (posted in November 2018). Even when disclosed, the list lacked transparency regarding parish assignments. Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul has investigated whether the church properly handled sexual abuse cases. Paprocki has also engaged in partisan political action, ordering priests to deny Democratic politicians communion.

name: Dr. W. David Hager
description: Dr. W. David Hager is a prominent obstetrician-gynecologist from Kentucky and anti-abortion advocate appointed by the Bush administration to the Reproductive Health Drugs Advisory Committee of the FDA in 2002. According to his ex-wife Linda Carruth Davis, Hager repeatedly sodomized her while she slept between 1995 and their divorce in 2002. Linda Davis was narcoleptic, and Hager would forcibly assault her during her sleep. She divorced him citing sexual and emotional abuse. In 2003, Hager remarried physician Kathleen Martin, but she filed for divorce from him in 2007, also citing sexual misconduct.

name: Don Haidl
description: Don Haidl was an assistant sheriff in Orange County, California. His son, Gregory Haidl (age 19 at the time), was one of three men charged in the July 2002 sexual assault of a 16-year-old girl. The victim was drugged and assaulted while unconscious on a pool table; she was penetrated with a lighted cigarette and pool cue, and the assault was videotaped. The first trial ended in a mistrial in June 2004 due to jury deadlock. In the retrial, Gregory Haidl and two co-defendants were convicted in March 2005. Gregory received a six-year prison sentence in 2006. Don Haidl used his position as sheriff to smear the victim and defend his son's actions, claiming the victim 'deserved it' because she was a 'slut.'

name: Neal Horsley
description: Neal Horsley (1944-2015) was a militant anti-abortion activist and Christian Reconstructionist. In 2005, Horsley admitted during an interview that he engaged in bestiality as an adolescent, stating 'When you grow up on a farm in Georgia, your first girlfriend is a mule.' He also boasted about having sex with men and abusing drugs. Horsley served a 30-month federal prison sentence in 1973 for possession of three gallons of hashish oil. He created and maintained the 'Nuremberg Files' website, which listed the names, addresses, and other details of abortion providers, health care workers, politicians, and judges who supported abortion rights. He also included a list of providers who had been wounded or killed, effectively creating a target list for violence.

name: Cardinal Bernard Francis Law
description: Cardinal Bernard Francis Law was the Archbishop of Boston from March 1984 until his resignation on December 13, 2002. He is one of the most prominent figures in the Catholic clergy sex abuse crisis. Documents revealed Law's extensive role in covering up incidents of sexual misconduct by priests under his authority. Law repeatedly transferred abusive clergy among parishes despite repeated allegations of child molestation, without alerting parents or police. Notable cases include priest John Geoghan who raped or molested over 130 children in six parishes. In January 2002, The Boston Globe published investigation results revealing Law's systematic cover-up. The archdiocese eventually paid $10 million to Geoghan's victims in 2002 and an additional $85 million to 552 victims and parents in 2003.
crime: conspiracy to cover up sexual abuse

name: Joseph M. McDade
description: Joseph M. McDade was an 18-term Republican U.S. Representative from Pennsylvania's 10th congressional district, serving from 1963 to 1998. He was acquitted in 1996 on federal bribery charges. In January 2007, after his retirement from Congress, McDade was accused by at least three women of indecent exposure at a beach resort in Sanibel, Florida. According to the allegations, McDade masturbated in front of female guests on the beach and by the pool. One witness stated she saw McDade masturbating 10-15 feet away from her, another claimed he followed his wife while masturbating, and a third reported he watched her leave her beach chair and followed her while masturbating. McDade was charged with first degree misdemeanor indecent exposure.

name: Robert A. McKee
description: Robert A. McKee was a member of the Maryland House of Delegates representing District 2A in Washington County since 1994. On January 31, 2008, Washington County Sheriff deputies searched McKee's home and seized several computers, videotapes, and other materials after receiving a tip about child pornography in the residence. A resident of the home had discovered and reported the child pornography to authorities, providing printed images to sheriff deputies. McKee resigned from office in February 2008. He pleaded guilty to possession of child pornography on September 5, 2008, and was sentenced to 37 months in federal prison followed by lifetime supervised probation. According to his plea agreement, McKee had obtained child pornography via the Internet and mail order as early as 2004.

name: William Henry O'Reilly
description: William Henry O'Reilly is a prominent conservative television host and political commentator for Fox News. In October 2004, television producer Andrea Mackris filed a sexual harassment lawsuit against O'Reilly, alleging he made sexually provocative phone calls and discussed personal sexual matters despite her discomfort. On the same day, O'Reilly filed a counter-suit accusing Mackris and her attorney of extortion. On October 28, 2004, the case was settled out of court for $9 million. The settlement included highly unusual provisions requiring all parties to disclaim any evidence as 'counterfeit or forgeries' should it become public. Mackris was required to 'lie—even in legal proceedings or under oath' if evidence surfaced. O'Reilly was later fired by Fox News in 2017 after multiple sexual harassment allegations were reported by The New York Times, leading to a major advertiser boycott.

name: Marshal A. Seymour
description: Marshal Seymour is a religious leader and former youth minister who faces charges of sexual abuse of minors. He was first arrested in July 1999 in Mobile, Alabama while working as a youth minister at Parkway Assembly of God, charged with second-degree sodomy and second-degree sexual abuse of a 16-year-old boy. The sodomy charge was dropped, and Seymour pleaded guilty to misdemeanor assault. His one-year jail sentence was suspended and he received one year probation. Nearly a decade later, in November 2007, Seymour was arrested again on charges of molesting three teenage boys (ages 15-17) he met through First Baptist Church at the Mall in Lakeland, Florida. He allegedly met victims through church and paid them money in exchange for sexual favors or silence. He faced charges of unlawful sexual activity with minors and using children in sexual performance. After jury selection began, he pleaded guilty and no contest to five felony charges, potentially facing up to 65 years in prison.

name: Kevin Alfred Strom
description: Kevin Alfred Strom is an American white nationalist, neo-Nazi, and white supremacist from Virginia who founded the National Vanguard in 2005, a breakaway group from the neo-Nazi National Alliance. On January 4, 2007, Strom was arrested in Greene County, Virginia on charges of possession of child pornography and witness tampering. According to reports, his wife caught him viewing child pornography on his home computer. At his plea hearing in January 2008, Strom pleaded guilty to one count of possession of child pornography in exchange for other charges being dropped. He was sentenced to 23 months in prison in April 2008. Following his arrest and conviction, the National Vanguard was disbanded. Strom had a documented long-time fascination with young girls and exploited his position within the extremist movement.

name: Daniel Dean Thompson
description: Daniel Dean Thompson, age 31, was arrested in 2008 on charges of unlawful sexual activity with minors and patronizing a minor prostitute. Thompson allegedly operated a film editing business that he claimed sanitized movies to remove objectionable content for family viewing, but the business served as a front for child sexual exploitation. According to police reports, Thompson and co-owner Isaac Lifferth allegedly paid two 14-year-old girls $20 each to perform oral sex. Police found a large quantity of pornographic movies inside the business along with a keg of beer, painkillers, and two cameras hooked up to a television. Thompson told the teen victims his film business was a cover for a pornography studio. He was charged with two counts of unlawful sexual activity with a minor and two counts of patronizing a prostitute. Note: Clean Flicks company later sued Thompson, claiming he falsely connected himself to their company and was never affiliated with it.

name: Lawrence Scott Ward
description: Lawrence Scott Ward was a 63-year-old professor at the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania, known for expertise on media effects on children. In August 2006, authorities discovered child pornography in his luggage and laptop computer when he arrived at Dulles International Airport near Washington, D.C., on a flight from Brazil. A search of his office at Wharton's Huntsman Hall uncovered over 80 images of Ward and a young boy (no older than 15) in intimate situations, with the boy featured in a series of pornographic DVDs found in Ward's mail. Ward pleaded guilty on May 17, 2007 to producing child pornography for importation into the United States, receiving 15 years in prison and a $17,500 fine. On November 17, 2008, he pleaded guilty to all four Pennsylvania child pornography and sexual misconduct charges and received an additional 25-year sentence.

name: James E. West
description: James E. West (Jim West) was a Republican politician from Spokane, Washington who served in the state legislature starting in 1982 and became mayor of Spokane in 2003. In May 2005, a local newspaper investigation published allegations that West had sexually molested young boys more than 20 years earlier, in the late 1970s or early 1980s. West was accused of abusing at least two young men during his time as a sheriff's deputy and while volunteering with the Boy Scouts as a troop leader. Although never formally charged, voters overwhelmingly recalled West from office in a special election on December 6, 2005, with 65% voting to oust him. His term ended on December 16, 2005. The FBI investigated the allegations but closed the case without taking action due to lack of sufficient evidence.

name: Steve Wilsey
description: Steve Wilsey was a youth counselor and activist affiliated with Focus on the Family, an evangelical Christian organization, and was reportedly a protégé of James Dobson, the founder of Focus on the Family. Wilsey was charged with and convicted of sexual assault after molesting an 8-year-old boy. His case represented a significant scandal for Focus on the Family and exposed the organization's vulnerability regarding child safety within its youth counseling programs.

name: Paul Williams
description: Paul Williams was a minister of prayer and special projects at Bellevue Baptist Church, a major Southern Baptist megachurch. In 2006, an internal church investigation revealed that Williams had sexually abused his son over a period of 12-18 months, beginning in 1990 when his son was an adolescent. Williams admitted to and was convicted of the sexual abuse. According to the investigation, church leaders including the current pastor, Reverend Steve Gaines, learned about the abuse but did not immediately report it to authorities. The abuse only came to light in December 2005 after Williams' son prodded Pastor Gaines to explain why his father was still allowed to serve as a minister. Williams was subsequently fired from his position at the church.

name: Glenn Murphy Jr.
description: Glenn Murphy Jr. was a prominent Republican politician who served as president of the Young Republican National Federation. In August 2007, he resigned from his position after being accused of sexually assaulting another man. The assault allegedly occurred on July 29, 2007, when Murphy, age 33, performed oral sex on a 22-year-old man without consent while the victim slept. The assault happened following a Young Republicans gathering and after a night of drinking at the victim's sister's house. Murphy pleaded not guilty to the charges but was convicted of class B felony sexual assault. He was sentenced to six years in prison and is now a registered sex offender. Additionally, another man had accused Murphy of sexual assault in 1998, though no charges were filed at that time.

name: Robert Holland
description: Robert Holland, 76, was a longtime Republican Township Supervisor in Bedminster Township, Pennsylvania and head of groundskeeper services at Pine Run Community Assisted Living Facility, where he supervised five employees. Holland was charged with multiple felony and misdemeanor counts of sexual assault after admitting to sexually assaulting a 92-year-old nursing home resident who was unable to give meaningful consent. Holland moved the victim from her alarmed wheelchair to a nearby sofa where he fondled and engaged in other sexual acts. Nursing assistant Martha Palena witnessed the assault and reported it. Holland's assaults spanned approximately six months from November 2005 until his discovery. He was arraigned on charges including aggravated indecent assault (2nd degree felony), institutional sexual assault (3rd degree felony), and three counts of misdemeanor indecent assault.

name: Leonard Ray Owens
description: Leonard Ray Owens is a pastor and antigay activist from Fort Worth, Texas. He was indicted on charges of sexual assault (a second-degree felony) after being accused of raping a church member who came to him for counseling following a miscarriage. According to police reports, Owens told the woman that she was possessed by a sex spirit and lesbian demon that needed to be cast out. He then allegedly asked her to lie on the floor where he conducted what he described as an exorcism, yelling at her as if performing a demonic casting, saying 'Loose her in the name of Jesus,' before he raped her. The alleged assaults occurred twice at his Fort Worth home. Owens was arrested in November 2006 and held on $25,000 bail, facing charges that could result in 2-20 years in prison.

name: Galen Fox
description: Galen Fox was a Hawaiian Republican State Representative and House Minority Leader. On December 17-18, 2004, the 61-year-old Fox took a late night flight from Honolulu to Los Angeles. During the flight, Fox committed a sex crime against the sleeping 27-year-old woman sitting beside him by groping her. He was convicted of misdemeanor sex abuse. Fox resigned from the Hawaii legislature on December 1, 2005. He was sentenced to three months of house arrest, three years probation, and a $2,500 fine. Fox was also ordered to register as a sex offender and to undergo a psychiatric examination or sex offender treatment program.

name: Albert Andre Zimmerman
description: Albert Andre Zimmerman, 41, was the former spokesman for the Florida Department of Children and Families (DCF), the state agency responsible for child protection and welfare. In February 2008, Zimmerman was indicted on charges of producing child pornography. According to investigators, Zimmerman solicited two teenagers, ages 16 and 17, to perform lewd acts that he photographed and videotaped for the purpose of creating pornography. Specifically, Zimmerman paid the boys to photograph themselves while masturbating with the intention of publishing and reselling the images as pornography. A former TV newsman, Zimmerman was fired by DCF following his arrest. In January 2009, he pleaded guilty to one count of producing child pornography. Other charges were dropped as part of a plea agreement. Zimmerman was sentenced to 24 years and four months in federal prison.

name: Allen D. Kauffman
description: Allen D. Kauffman, 63, was the mayor of Collins, Missouri (a small town of about 200 people) and pastor of the Temple Lot Church in Collins. In late 2007, Kauffman was arrested on four counts of felony enticement of a child following an Internet sting operation. According to prosecutors, Kauffman believed he was communicating with a 13-year-old girl in a Yahoo chat room during November and December 2007. In reality, he was communicating with Jim Murray, a retired detective from Diamond, Missouri who conducts online child sex predator stings. Murray's sting operations have led to over 20 arrests with more than half resulting in prison time for adults convicted of soliciting sex from minors. Kauffman resigned from his positions as mayor of Collins and pastor of Temple Lot Church following the charges.
